column1: Principal causes of death and infant mortality rate: numbers and age-standardised death rates per 100,000 population, 2007 to 2016
Cancer of the Trachea, Bronchus and Lung:
External causes of injury and poisoning
Sources: Central Statistics Office,  Public Health Information System (PHIS) - Department of Health.
(i) (p)  The figures for 2016 are provisional. They should be treated with caution as they refer to deaths registered in these years and may be incomplete.
(ii) The rates provided in the table are age-standardised to the European standard population and are presented as  rates per 100,000 population except for
infant mortality rates which are expressed as deaths per 1,000 live births.
(iii) *Excludes cancer of the trachea, bronchus and lung.
